header.#text:
Findings; sense
			 of the House of Representatives regarding diabetes prevention under the
			 Medicaid program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
makes the following
			 findings:

text.#text:
The prevalence and
			 cost of diabetes is a significant concern for State Medicaid programs. By 2021,
			 the Medicaid program is expected to cover 13,000,000 people with diabetes and
			 about 9,000,000 people who may have pre-diabetes. By 2021, States will spend an
			 estimated $83,000,000,000 on individuals with diabetes or pre-diabetes.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, has been proven to reduce the onset of diabetes in at-risk
			 adults by 58 percent, using a cost-effective, community-based
			 intervention.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Centers for Disease Control
			 and Prevention

text.#text:
The National
			 Diabetes Prevention Program, as established by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that the National Diabetes Prevention Program presents an
			 opportunity for States to reduce the incidence of diabetes among individuals
			 enrolled in their Medicaid programs.

text.#text: It is the sense of the

header.#text:
Sense of the
			 House of Representatives
